Question 12 
[Strength of Materials : Properties of Metals, Stress and Strain]
 
 
A hanger is made of two bars of different sizes. Each bar has a square cross-section. The hanger is 
loaded by three-point loads in the mid vertical plane as shown in the figure. Ignore the self-weight of the 
hanger. What is the maximum tensile stress in N/mm
2

Question 13 
 
[RCC Structures : IS Recommendations & Fundamentals]
 
 
Creep of concrete under compression is defined as the ________. 
 
(A) increase in the magnitude of strain under constant stress 
 
(B) increase in the magnitude of stress under constant strain 
 
(C) decrease in the magnitude of strain under constant stress 
 
(D) decrease in the magnitude of stress under constant strain 
Ans. (A) 
Sol.
 
Creep is the time dependent deformation due to a continuous static loading (stress) acting on a elastic 
material for a long period of time. 
 
Creep strain = Elastic strain Creep coefficient

Hence, the correct option is (A). 
 
Key Point :
Age of loading 
7 days 
28 days 
1 year




1.1
